details.purpose: Use to capture and report Boston Carpal Tunnel Questionnaire (BOSTON) score details.
details.use:
Use to capture and report Boston Carpal Tunnel Questionnaire Score.
While openEHR archetypes are all freely available under an open license, the specific content of this archetype may be copyright protected. Any use of this archetype within implementations must be in compliance with the terms established by the copyright owners where a copyright exists.
details.misuse: Not to be used unless the terms of copyright have been observed (if a copyright exists).
details.copyright: Â© Clinical Models UK, Apperta Foundation

items.items: Boston Carpal Tunnel Questionnaire Score (BOSTON)
Boston Carpal Tunnel Questionnaire Score.
Event Series
@ internal @
Point in time
A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Tree
@ internal @
Tree
@ internal @
Extension
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with HL7 or CDISC equivalents.
1 Severity at night
Patient-reported extent of hand or wrist pain at night.

Questionnaire wording:
1. How severe is the hand or wrist pain that you have at night?
I do not have hand or wrist pain at night
The patient does not have hand or wrist pain at night.
Mild pain
The patient has mild hand or wrist pain at night.
Moderate pain
The patient has moderate hand or wrist pain at night.
Severe pain
The patient has severe hand or wrist pain at night.
Total score
Total score from Questions 1 to 11.
Average score
Average score from Questions 1-11.
2 Frequency waking due to pain
Patient-reported extent of hand or wrist pain at waking them at night.

Questionnaire wording:
2. How often did hand or wrist pain wake you up during a typical night in the past two weeks?
Never
The patient did not wake because of hand or wrist pain at night in the past two weeks.
Once
The patient woke once because of hand or wrist pain at night in the past two weeks.
Two or three times
The patient woke two or three times because of hand or wrist pain at night in the past two weeks.
Four or five times
The patient woke four or five times of hand or wrist pain at night in the past two weeks.
Very severe pain
The patient has very severe hand or wrist pain at night.
3 Daytime pain
Patient-reported extent of hand or wrist pain at during the daytime.

Questionnaire wording:
3. Do you typically have pain in your hand or wrist during the daytime?
I never have pain during the day
The patient does not have hand or wrist pain during the day.
I have mild pain during the day
The patient has mild hand or wrist pain during the day.
I have moderate pain during the day
The patient has moderate hand or wrist pain during the day.
I have severe pain during the day
The patient has severe hand or wrist pain during the day.
I have very severe pain during the day
The patient has very severe hand or wrist pain during the day.
More than five times
The patient woke more than five times of hand or wrist pain at night in the past two weeks.
4 Frequency of daytime pain
Patient-reported extent frequency of hand or wrist pain at during the daytime.

Questionnaire wording:
4. How often do you have hand or wrist pain during the daytime?
Never
The patient does not have hand or wrist pain during the day.
Once or twice a day
The patient has hand or wrist pain once or twice a day.
Three to five times a day
The patient has hand or wrist pain three to five times a day.
More than five times a day
The patient has hand or wrist pain more than five times a day.
The pain is constant
The patient has constant hand or wrist pain during the day.
5 Duration of daytime pain
Patient-reported extent duration of hand or wrist pain at during the daytime.

Questionnaire wording:
5. How long on average does an episode of pain last during the daytime?
I never get pain during the day
The patient does not have hand or wrist pain during the day.
Less than 10 minutes
The patient has experiences an episode of hand or wrist pain for less than 10 minutes during the day.
10 to 60 minutes
The patient has experiences an episode of hand or wrist pain for 10 to 60 minutes during the day.
Greater than 60 minutes
The patient has experiences an episode of hand or wrist pain for greater than 60 minutes during the day.
The pain is constant throughout the day
The patient has experiences constant episodes of hand or wrist pain during the day.
6 Numbness
Patient-reported extent of numbness (loss of sensation) in hand.

Questionnaire wording:
6. Do you have numbness (loss of sensation) in your hand?
No
The patient does not have numbness in hand.
I have mild numbness
The patient has mild numbness in hand.
I have moderate numbness
The patient has moderate numbness in hand.
I have severe numbness
The patient has severe numbness in hand.
I have very severe numbness
The patient has very severe numbness in hand.
7 Weakness
Patient-reported extent of weakness in hand or wrist.

Questionnaire wording:
7. Do you have weakness in your hand or wrist?
No weakness
The patient does not have weakness in hand or wrist.
Mild weakness
The patient has mild weakness in hand or wrist.
Moderate weakness
The patient has moderate weakness in hand or wrist.
Severe weakness
The patient has severe weakness in hand or wrist.
Very severe weakness
The patient has very severe weakness in hand or wrist.
8 Tingling
Patient-reported extent of tingling in hand or wrist.

Questionnaire wording:
7. Do you have weakness in your hand or wrist?
No tingling
The patient does not have tingling in hand or wrist.
Mild tingling
The patient has mild tingling in hand or wrist.
Moderate tingling
The patient has moderate tingling in hand or wrist.
Severe tingling
The patient has severe tingling in hand or wrist.
Very severe tingling
The patient has very severe tingling in hand or wrist.
9 Numbness or Tingling at night
Patient-reported extent of numbness (loss of sensation) or tingling in hand or wrist at night.

Questionnaire wording:
9. How severe is the numbness (loss of sensation) or tingling at night?
I have no numbness or tingling at night
The patient does not have numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night.
Mild
The patient has mild numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night.
Moderate
The patient has moderate numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night.
Severe
The patient has severe numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night.
Very severe
The patient has very severe numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night.
10 Frequency waking due to numbness
Patient-reported frequency waking due to numbness (loss of sensation) or tingling in hand or wrist at night.

Questionnaire wording:
10. How often did hand numbness or tingling wake you up during a typical night during the past two weeks?
Never
The patient was not woken due to numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night during the past two weeks.
Once
The patient was woken once due to numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night during the past two weeks.
Two or three times
The patient was woken two or three times due to numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night during the past two weeks.
Four or five times
The patient was woken four or five times due to numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night during the past two weeks.
More than five times
The patient was woken more than five times due to numbness or tingling in hand or wrist at night during the past two weeks.
11 Difficulty grasping
Patient-reported level of difficulty grasping and using small objects such as keys or pencils.

Questionnaire wording:
11. Do you have difficulty with grasping and use of small objects such as keys or pencils?
No difficulty
The patient has no difficulty grasping and using small objects such as keys or pencils.
Mild difficulty
The patient has mild difficulty grasping and using small objects such as keys or pencils.
Moderate difficulty
The patient has moderate difficulty grasping and using small objects such as keys or pencils.
Severe difficulty
The patient has severe difficulty grasping and using small objects such as keys or pencils.
Very severe difficulty
The patient has very severe difficulty grasping and using small objects such as keys or pencils.
